Review title: Actually a real good fantasy movie
Review_body: To many reviewers are not letting their inner child getting to enjoy a well casted and well written fantasy action movie. What a shame. I thought this was perfect entertainment and would recommend everyone that likes fantasy movies to watch this. Thumbs up.

Review title: Much better than you have been told
Review_body: So, this is a big budget action and special effects movie about Egyptian gods battling each other to rule the world, right? When you go to a movie like this, you have certain expectations--its not likely to be on the Best Picture short list next Oscar season, and everyone involved with making this movie knew this. But from the very first breathtaking camera shot, you can tell The Gods of Egypt was crafted with enthusiasm and a spirit of fun and unrelenting inhibition. For what this movie was striving for, it is absolutely on target. I saw it on IMax 3-D with my 5th and 7th grade sons, and we loved every minute! Visually dazzling, a soaring musical score, satisfying play-to-the-back-row acting, interesting and somewhat unfamiliar mythological characters, amazing costumes and set pieces--I think this film delivered on all fronts. In a way, Gods of Egypt is more original than many similar films of this genre in that it is not a prequel or sequel or reboot of a franchise, or a comic book adaptation. For instance, while it shares its episodic and implausible plot and style, it is a far more original film than the beloved Episode VII (but without decades of nostalgia and anticipation to paper over its weaknesses). It introduces and creates characters completely new to us in a fascinating and beautiful imaginary world. You will not forget the striking image of the stern but grandfatherly sun god Ra (Geoffrey Rush plays it large here!) circling the disk of the world with his space craft/chariot, sun in tow, as he daily battles a hideous chaos monster in defense of all humanity! The judgment of souls in the underworld is another well-presented scene. Horus has a nice character arc. It ends with a worthwhile message from the gods to humanity. More importantly, it literally offers a thrill or two every 5 minutes for its entire duration. And unexpectedly, this film has no mummies whatsoever! I feel the culturally inaccurate casting issue, while perhaps regrettable, brought an undeserved sense of negativity about this film. In any event, these actors appeared to be 100% invested in making this film work, and they got the job done, in my opinion. We recommend that you set this concern aside and enjoy the many pleasures The Gods of Egypt offers--a no-expenses-spared B movie that presents striking and immersive visuals, appealing characters, and a clear understanding of its limitations and aspirations. I seriously don't understand the horrible reviews, and suppose that people who hated this film probably brought a preconceived negative expectation in with their popcorn. Give it a chance, there is much to enjoy in The Gods of Egypt!
This was so entertaining and amazing. I loved it so much and went to the movie theater twice to see it. I kind of miss and want to see it again. Great fantasy movie.

The Gods of Egypt is a beautifully told traditional fantasy story about love, hate, pride, envy, commitment, betrayal, sacrifice and many other essential themes of humanity wrapped in the cosmic struggle of light and darkness. It's by no means perfect, and some times the acting comes off as cringe-worthy, but the overall movie is well worth watching, and might just bring a tear or two to your eyes if you're not careful.This is the kind of film that can be safely enjoyed in any company, although the angstiest of teenagers might get uncomfortable with all the emotions, both joyful and sad, this movie takes you through. For adults and those young children whose innocence hasn't yet been spoiled by the act-tough teenager culture, this is a journey well worth taking.

Fun movie and the actors obviously loved making it. Humour and good acting. Lots of CGI which could have been better but it doesn't matter because the action and story keep you entertained. Preferred this to any of those super hero blockbusters because it doesn't take itself too seriously. Some of these reviewers just didn't get it and were expecting another USA fan boy comic movie. It works on the comic level too though just made in Sydney Australia with Canadian backing and lacks the USA flag waving. Another of those films that did a lot better internationally than in the US market. Australia's Brenton Thwaites was great as the young mortal and Game of Throne's Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau as Horus was as good as always. It also included Scotland's Gerard Butler and Australia's Geoffrey Rush, Brian Brown and others. This is nothing like the Exodus of last year even though it seems to be similar in theme. A great movie for all ages that just rolls along with plenty to entertain and amuse you.

Review title: MY KIDS LOVE IT AND SO WILL YOURS!!! Magnificent (visually). MY KIDS LOVED IT MORE THAN "Star Wars: The Force Awakens" TO MY SURPRISE!!!
Review_body: MY KIDS LOVE IT AND SO WILL YOURS!!! Magnificent (visually)!!! Why, because it's truly better than "Clash of the Titans" through the kids eyes!!! Gosh, adults are so spoiled today!!! Remember the kind of movies you used to see when you were a KID??? I wished there were movies like this in my childhood that are so visually stunning, plus thrilling with all those amazing unique characters!!! Didn't you loathe watching the same old movies on TV or in the theater as a kid and you had no choice? I grew up watching over and over, every single year, movies like "The Thief of Bagdad", "Clash of the Titans", "Sinbad of the Seven Seas", "Moses", "Spartacus", and various versions of Gladiator movies, too. I LOVE TO TAKE MY KIDS TO THE MOVIES ALL THE TIME, AND THEY HAVE SEEN LOTS OF SUMMER MOVIES EVERY SINGLE YEAR. SHOCKING TO ME AS A MOTHER, THAT MY 16 YEARS OLD, 12 YEARS OLD, AND 9 YEARS OLD SONS CLAPPED LOUDLY AT THE END OF THE MOVIE AND SAID THEY LOVED EVERY BIT OF IT. WHY, BECAUSE THEY FELT THEY WERE THE INDIANA JONES IN AN Egypt STORY, A THRILLING JOURNEY OF DISCOVERY ALL THROUGH THIS MOVIE, PLUS FIGHTING UNIQUE VILLAINS, CREATURES, AND GODS, AND THEY LOVED IT MORE THAN THE NEW STAR WARS MOVIE. I love Star Wars, but I grew up with it as a child, while my kids watch too much Star Wars cartoons on cable and seen all the past Star Wars movie. THIS IS AN ULTRA FANTASY MOVIE, SO DIFFERENT FOR MY KIDS EYES THAN TYPICAL STAR TREK, STAR WARS, AND A BUNCH OF OTHERS. MY KIDS GOT TO BECOME VARIOUS DIFFERENT AND THRILLING CHARACTERS ALL THROUGH THIS MOVIE, SO WILL YOURS TOO. I enjoyed this so much more than Clash of the Titans. In this movie, there's hot muscular men for the ladies and drop dead gorgeous model-like ladies for the men. So everybody wins!!! LOL! The only reason it didn't do well is that it should have come out in the summer, NOT after Deadpool, which ROCKS or after Valentine's Day. It's worth the RPX expensive tickets I spent. We had a blast!!! Hope for more positive reviews!!! Definitely, worth watching in the theater, NOT in a few month on your TV. I have a 80" TV and the theater is still fantastic for these types of action pack movies!!!

Review title: Read the Reviews not the Rating
Review_body:
At the time of writing the rating is 5.4. which I think is far to low. I agree with the positive reviews. Yes it has all the cliches and inconsistencies you would expect from such a CGI festival of ancient myths, but above all it is an enjoyable movie.
I don't generally watch the marvel/star wars type movies so I was tempted to give this a wide berth however I have an interest in Egyptian mythology fully expecting to turn it off after ten minutes or so. The special effects are spectacular and the humour is unexpected. 
I can understand the critics rating of a measly 25 I wouldn't have expected anything else from them, but this film is also better than the current 5.4

It's pure fun! I don't get the negativity,this movie is very enjoyable. Solid story, good music, very good 3D. Loved the costumes! There was a bunch of interesting ideas.Action-packed,and it teaches us a lesson about judging a person's worth.Critics are morons.So in my humble opinion,this was a wonderful sci-fi fantasy movie with gorgeous costumes, rich artistic design and a fun story. Quit taking yourself so seriously and go and have fun at the movies for a change!!!!I'm talking to the professional critics,You got it way wrong on this film!!! If i want to watch a historically accurate, highly praised composition,i check out a documentary channel,but for Saturday afternoon with friends,it was perfect.By the way,my friends enjoyed it as well! :)

Where to begin.Nice graphics, nice effects, but the idea was probably better than the result. I didn't expect much, since as soon as I saw the trailer and saw Butler stars in it, I kinda expected it will not be good. Not saying I don't like Butler, but he was such a BAD BAAAAD terrible choice for this role, it could be worse only if it was Adam Sandler.Bek and Zaya relationship and characters were too cheesy and the whole thing didn't work out too well. All the stuff with him going to steal eyes for Horus happened too fast, the storytelling had huge holes in it. Then there are the way over-the-top parts like the whole Ra character and Seth attaching parts of other gods to his body...etc. Overall watchable, but nothing that would stand out or would blow you away.After The Crow and I, Robot, Proyas made a very mediocre piece. Fit for carefree popcorn night for people that just want to kill time and don't look for a decent cinematography.

Having heard the tremendous amount of negative reviews I was somewhat hesitant to see the movie. I'm glad to have watched it. It's not likely to win any Oscars, but for once it's not a reboot or a sequel.This is pure escapism with good CGI, an enjoyable story and some decent acting. True, the story isn't very complicated, but it depicts a hero's journey very well. Two heroes, a sceptical thief and a defeated god. The fact that they made Gods as separate race of beings, easily over 10 feet tall with golden blood was an added bonus to emphasise that despite their human features, they are anything but. Elodie Young as Hathor was probably one of my favourites. The story resisted the trope portraying her as Egyptian Venus, instead using another one of her roles as the "Mistress of the West", welcoming people into the next life. Another very pleasant surprise was the architect played by Rufus Sewell. A minor role, but performed extremely well.I do wish they spent more time explaining about the afterlife and the role of Apophis. All in all, good fun.

A decent cast but that's about it. The acting was awful and dialogue even worse. Bek doesn't speak like he's ever had a conversation in his life, whether that's the actor's ability or the way he was written.CGI at times wasn't good at all.A barely watchable movie.

The high marks for this movie are obviously bogus. It looks to have been written by a twelve-year old. There are no redeeming features, unfortunately. Sadly it is utter childish rubbish. This movie was so awful I could not leave this site without remarking on it's utter lack of plot or credibility. The information states that it cost $140,000,000 to produce. Judging by the number of 10's this movie received I'd say they must have spent it on paid reviewers.Don't say I didn't warn you.

Review title: Heureusement, je n'avais pas regardé la note avant! Pas déçue.
Review_body: Très divertissant. La note globale est un peu dure je trouve. Bon film fantasy
Everything is great in this movie.i love it so much.

Review title: It's too bad to be this long!
Review_body: Big names can't make up for terrible writing and average CGI.
I was great fun, was even touched by the love story, and the character evolution.

Review title: One of the greatest movies of all time?
Review_body: OK, first let me start off by saying this is one of the greatest movies I have ever had the pleasure of watching. I watched this on a pirated 480p dvdrip on my iphone 4s. The CGI was stunning! The scenery was so authentic I really felt i was in the ancient Egypt. (by the way, did you know Egypt is located in Asia?) The main role is played by the handsome Jaime Lannister, and King Leonidas. (How did he get all the way from Sparta to Asia?) I personally believe the actors used method acting, because you could really see the raw emotions portrayed in this masterpiece of a movie. TMZ also reported that Jaime Lannister walked around with a blindfold for a whole year preparing for this movie. Thats what I call dedication! This movie made Egypt great again. This movie brings forth so many emotions, and i can personally promise you that when Bek smiles, you will smile too. 10/10 will watch again, instant classic!

This movie was a journey that went to a lot of places but still didn't go anywhere. There were good actors in this movie but the dialogue was just comical. 
The CGI was also in some places like Play-Doh stop motion. It was such a mess this movie that it ended up being somewhat entertaining. Watch it just so you can have a giggle that they spent 140 million making it and have just this to show for it.

I liked the movie very much. Not every movie needs to be dark and Nolan-ish and we need more movies like this. I believe most negative reviews come from the not so convincing performance of Bek who needs more experience but did fairly well, the overly funny God of wisdom who could have been written better, more serious and with a more mystical allure and last but not least with the overly villainous part played by G. Butler who went a little over the edge with his acting here. Still, even so. A love story played on multiple fronts with great characters and a good plot. If only they took longer to characterize everyone and build up the story. 2 hours is not enough. It needed at least three.

Review title: Learn about many of the gods and goddesses of ancient Egypt.
Review_body:
Action packed, educational and entertaining.
I learned a lot about other gods and goddesses of ancient Egypt.

As a movies lover, this "Gods of Egypt" thing just made me sick. This 2 hour torture session will make you leave your sit and hope you were just having a bad dream. The entire Egypt population has been whitewashed and turned into blue eyed blondies. It's OK, if you put history aside and just enjoy the ride, the problem is, this isn't even the biggest issue that makes Gods of Egypt such a flop. The CGI were just UNBEARABLE and it makes me wonder how any human being (or even gods) could think that this was OK to be released to public. If the visual effect supervisor ever get another job, it would be nothing less than a miracle.It was impossible to like any of the characters, also. I couldn't care less about those guys with such a bad acting on screen. The comic approach they've tried - maybe taking a hike in Marvel's successful action-comedy-light movies - didn't work here at all.In the end, established names as Gerard Butller and even a decent actor as Chadwick Boseman (Black Panther) will eventually look back and think, "why did i ever do this?"Do your brain a favor and run away from this.

Ridiculous. Six good movies die each time turds like this get made. Ridiculous and tragic. Apparently, I haven't written enough lines for this to count as a proper review. Fine...The whole thing is a god-awful mishmash of so many other movies that it gave me a headache just thinking about it: Young Indiana Jones - the thief bits (only Indi wouldn't be caught dead wearing a loincloth), Dune - for the flying sand snake mounts and also for the giant space worm(hole?), 300 - Gerard Butler just won't let it lie, will he?Anyway, I originally gave this a '2', but because I had to put so much thought into a review I'm reducing it to '1'. Thanks, IMDb!

Review title: East Enders In Eygpt! Poor Produtction
Review_body: Its seemed to start off with a hopeful opening narration but it didn't last. The worst film I've seen in years. The whole point of making a film is make the audience forget they are watching a film. With its bad casting and the none existence of black people was a ignorant decisions. I guess that's a Hollywood thing. The statues where also not correct in the introduction. I found it to be just a lazy production. I also felt the screening was wrong. At times it felt like the camera shots where framed to far at times. East Enders in Africa is how I would describe this for friends. The narration should have stopped but it drones on seeking to save more money on actual screen play. you may find a few miss matches in sets due to mixing scenes like a day time TV feel show then back again.

I can't really speak to the entire movie, because as soon as I finished my medium popcorn I got up and left. Another patron must have purchased a small size, because she left before I did. And, as there were only four of us in the theater, in a small town in the afternoon, that was half of the viewers! Nothing was engaging. I'm not normally a sci-fi, mythological, special effects, solid action type of movie-goer. I went to see "Thor" because it was all that was playing and LOVED it, because it was a good and very entertaining movie, snappy dialogue, etc.This movie was just plain awful. I couldn't believe the crappy special effects, especially in light of some of the amazing movies out lately (like Thor). The dialogue sucked. The big-God/little-mortal thing was creepy.I believe I've only walked out of two movies in my whole life: The Leopard with Burt Lancaster (yes, back when dinosaurs roamed the earth) and Wild Hogs (but I rented that, so I it doesn't really count). Of course, I try not to go see crappy movies in the first place. Gods of Egypt - my bad.

Personally while I feel there were a great many flaws in the movie. I still found much enjoyment in watching it. Yes the CGI was fairly poor. But it was not so horrendous as to render it unwatchable. I also like Gerald Butler and the guy who played Horus. I would like to see a sequel where Horus goes after the Goddess of Love Hathor. It is in my opinion a worthy buy when it comes out on Blu-Ray. I hope that if they do ever get a green light they fix a few things but in general keep the same flow as they had in this film. I wouldn't mind seeing some of those characters return. Anyways I love Egyptian Mythology and even though this was not something you'd want to base your term paper on. It was still something to eat some popcorn invite a chick over and have a nice evening while watching a action/love story. I may seem to be all over the place but that is because I just finished watching it myself. I wasn't disappointed in the film. Nor did I care that most of the main actors were "White". Personally if you look back in the history of acting it really didn't matter the color or sex as most actors who even played women were men dressed up. So I don't hop on this senseless PC race train. I just watch for the story or the plain entertainment of the film. So I say bring on another one. Or write some cheap novels based off the screen play I'd read it.

Reading the past reviews that rate this movie as 10/10 is laughable. Clearly the studio's minions desperately trying to resuscitate this dead corpse of a movie. I actually signed up with the sole purpose of posting a review for this movie. A task that outshines the level of effort put into the making of this joke of a movie.It failed to hold my interest for more than 30 minutes by which time I felt I wanted to pour bleach on my eyes. A colossal failure of a movie adding insult to injury by associating itself with a great ancient civilization. The Pharoahs are puking in their dead mouths as we speak. This movie could exterminate rats who would die from boredom and frantically claw out each other's eyes. It helped me appreciate other movies I thought were bad. Clash of the Titans, I am sorry.It's success lies in it's ability to turn $140 million into an audiovisual disaster.

I really enjoyed this movie; the cast, dialog and effects. I didn't go see the Gods of Egypt for a lesson in Egyptian history (it's science fiction), I went to be entertained...which in my opinion this move does quite well. When reading some of the negative or poor reviews, it bring me to the truth that I know that there are some people that are just too up tight, or just like to put other people's work down. To each their own.If you enjoy a good, clean (I don't recall any bad language in this move), action and adventure move, go see this movie on the big screen and enjoy it. If you are looking for an accurate account of ancient Egyptian history, find a documentary on the History channel to watch.

Yet another mixture of all the famous tropes that you've already seen in a hundred different movies, veiled in a somewhat interesting setting that just doesn't work.It was an interesting concept, that fell completely flat due to lack of originality in every thing the movie tries to do. Action scenes couldn't convey any emotions, dialogues and plot felt completely bland with a number of low-effort comedy scenes and a cast that simply didn't fit. But what about the visuals? Well, the movie tried to put special effects in every second of the movie. That resulted in half of them being noticeably terrible and unconvincing. Some of these could be called more or less spectacular, yet certainly hard to appreciate considering how most of it was gibberish.In case you're still considering going to the cinema: my only advice is to watch the trailer carefully to see if you don't get put off by some of the special effects. If you do, there's much worse to come and you'd better save the money.

Review title: Not the worst movie ever, but close.
Review_body: First of all, if you love the guy, send him into a death trap to steal from a bad temper god only for your believing in another shitty god. Sure, why not? If he'll die, just use your hotness to find another idiot to do it. Second. "My love is not really important I can get her at any time, let's just revive those people first even though they could totally be together in the afterlife and that's what matters. But no, I'm an emotional god who can't stand the thing that mortals have to be mortal. Gotta revive them all for happy ending." Third. Two giant snakes can't break one freaking pole which they're hiding behind. Plus, when the white one fired at Bek, the fire couldn't reach him when it was obviously he was in the reach. Why? Because main actor, bitches. The one who looks like Egypt here is Hathor. Maybe only her. Bek is annoying brat. Zaya is a heartless bitch. Thoth's acting made me cry. The crowd reaction when gods fighting is priceless. "Interesting. Must watch and cheer."
Love the movie. Should be more of this kind of movies

1. The film starts with poacher propaganda
2. Egyptians were not white-skinned europeans, not even their gods.
3. Egypt mithology and history deserves much more than this crap.

In truth, I was expecting a horrible movie. And in that way the movie definitely did no disappoint. But to be honest I kind of didn't even expect it to be this awful. The acting is just....oh my god. I just felt awkward. Direction was complete horror. Story was not at all interesting, and the CGI was just so bad it's ridiculous. But if you want a movie to make fun of and cry your eyes out of pure stupidity, than you should definitely watch it. Otherwise, just... Don't. If you have any kind of a good opinion on Nikolaj and Gerard. And Geoffrey Rush. Any of the actors in it. Just avoid it. For the love of god, run away from it. Many people were trying to defend it in a way that it's a ''fantasy movie is supposed to be that way''. OH MY GOD THAT IS NOT TRUE. Cause that just says that every fantasy movie is supposed to be bad?! Come on people..... Wow.

Review title: Maybe the worst movie i've seen this year...
Review_body: After 5 seconds i look over my GF and our look said the same..what The F#$% is this? i were with high expectations because i am a lover of Egyptian mythology and because of Gerard Butler, but it all fall down , the history sucks and even the production seems from the series of Pokemon, i really hate it...Horus for me is one of the Stars of Game of thrones, but please, stay there, don't accept this awful rolls in very week movies, is not good for your image, although i didn't even recognize it, better that way, maybe i do need the eye of Horus to see some good acting in that movie, Gerard Butler did is part but it's a banal Villain, the boy i'm sorry but stay in the series Glee or where the hell you were from because it isn't working, the Girl and the wife of Gerard Butler are super hot loll but speaking of acting..hmmmmm..maybe not that good..

This movie was exciting, action-packed, adventurous and I loved every second of it... My only mistake was not watching sooner. If you're into Egyptian mythology I highly recommend this film, thanks for creating it

As I entered the theater I knew I would need to leave my brain at the door and sit there with popcorn enjoying a visually spectacular movie. And that's what I got. At first, the dialogue and acting were cheesy. Normally, it would continue like that. Well, somewhere along the way it either stopped being cheesy or I just didn't notice it anymore. By the time the movie ended I felt entertained. I didn't feel as if I had wasted time or money. So, for me, it was a good movie.Now on to the racial controversy. My question is why is there even a controversy about this? The movie takes place in an ALTERNATE Earth Egypt. I mean, the world is flat and Ra created everything. Seems silly to put out the effort to protest a movie that has no basis in history whatsoever.

When i watched this movie.poor CGI and simple story bothered me. almost i could predict the whole of the story.and casting was poor except antagonist(Gerard Butler).i could not understand and connect with Brenton Thwaites as one of the heroes.. this movie had potential to be one of the admirable movies .but it was waste of money and time.in addition weak story could not make any sense for me.

Gods of Egypt is almost stunning to watch but the dialogue appears to have been written by a seven year old. Full of wisecracking, smart arsed characters spouting 'aren't we cool' lines that detract from the film.

Review title: I like the movie so Much
Review_body: I don't know why people don't like this movie, but i personally like this movie. I love ancient story and found Everything's nice, at first i found it was awkward of why this movie looked a little bit much modern when the plot should have been many thousand years ago but since this was a god's story then the God could create anything they wanted and of course the luxury life of God as well. and the ending of story was a bit rushing as well, the death of the antagonist could be improved much better than that. But i still love the plot and i do intend to see a sequel here since the ending is definitely leading us to future sequel story.

Review title: Stunning Visuals, Boundless Potential, yet Wretched Pathetic Scripting
Review_body: I for one was extremely enthusiastic towards the idea of a movie revolving around Egyptian mythology - especially in light of all the Greek-centric movies out there. I cannot stress how beautiful and stunning the imagery was throughout the entirety of the film. Although the look of the transformed Horus came off as entirely overdone and banal in reference to the myriad of other protagonists in shows and movies in the last few years appearing with similarly angel-esque wings, the vast majority of the visuals were outstanding.Several enthralling concepts were also presented that added a very distinct flavor to the movie - concepts rarely if ever dealt with or portrayed, especially in this genre. The breath-taking view of the flat-earth, the idea of Ra fighting off a giant alien-esque behemoth as it came from the void to devour the earth - both elements fairly unique to the film. But the script and the plot in general were just appalling. To preface, if any of my specific complaints are due to not personally being that familiar with Egyptian mythology than the movie could be argued to have failed in educating its viewers to the point where things made enough sense.Firstly, I am a strong proponent for the concept that any notion, no matter how seemingly far-fetched can be made believable if enough energy is put into justifying or explaining how such a thing happened. So Set is warring across the lands and taking out kingdoms of other gods... Wait, explain to me why the Gods haven't teamed up to take this pretentious prick out? No explanation is given so we are left to assume that either the other gods are all insufferably obtuse or the film-makers didn't care to enlighten us or just flat- out didn't have a reason. But why not??? It would be so easy to implement and would add so much value! It would be as easy as making up some kind of deity-level contract/oath/bloodoath/whatever that prevented the gods from banding together in some interesting and intriguing way. Oh noes! Set is attacking us one by one and we are all under oath so we can't intervene; all we can do is wait until it's our turn! But again, no attempt at an explanation was given.And if Set is so secluded, god of the barren deserts, how does he have the backing and the manpower to take out every single other god? Does he actually rule his own city? Is his army magically conjured? Did he steal another god's army? And if he has his own city, why is he acting so incredibly petulant and butt-hurt? Wait, so Set is super lonely and forlorn and boo-hoo poor baby but he has how many other gods working for him? Minotaur gods (that obviously don't deserve god-hod given their pitiful fight scene) and two random snake-affiliated gods? Were they always working together? Were they aligned with the rest of the gods then turned on them? Why even portray random NPC minotaur 1, 2, and 3 as gods at all? Why not portray them as beasts instead of diluting the semblance of potency of the gods?And the scene with the hall of traps... So let me get this straight: not only is their an easy-to-access blueprint showing most of the traps but the floor is covered with scorpions - and you just dump tons of gold onto the floor. There was infinitely more thought put into the revolving clockwork-esque mechanism through which the gold was dumped then the actual vault/trap-room. To top it all off, the character Beck (sp?) rides an avalanche of gold ornaments, tools, possibly blades and then jumps a good 50 or more feet down onto a pile of the same stuff and escapes without a scratch. Then he somehow escapes the vault because in all that time, no magical alarms went off, the scorpions are allergic to shiny eyeballs, and apparently the vault is really easy to get out of - easy enough to not warrant showing it on scene.Beck's lover is shot with an arrow that drives deep into her boob. He quickly rips out the barbed, wide-headed arrow with little to no reaction from the girl and leaving only a tiny hole from which she barely oozes a drop of blood yet somehow dies seconds (or was it minutes? Hours? Days?) later. I certainly hope it wasn't as quick of a chariot ride as it appeared because that would mean Horus was living in exposed squalor within a huge hard-to-miss landmark just a quick jog from Set. Which provokes the question: If Set knows where Horus is, why is he still alive?Beck in general is way too cheesy - everything he says just drips cheesiness... He is the abomination birthed of the stereotypical fantasy- themed rogue-type and Aladdin - a combination ill-fitting the epic potential of the movie.I could go on for days but the point is the visuals and concepts were amazing but they were overshadowed with an ill-conceived atrocious plot and script.9/10 on visuals 6/10 on innovative themes/concepts 1/10 on plot 2/10 on acting 1/10 on script

This is a very mediocre movie. The CGI is horrible, the acting even worse. I don't have a problem with how inaccurate the movie is, but poor acting cannot be forgiven. The storyline isn't great either. They could have done a better job at making the story more compelling. The shoddy acting just adds to the already shoddy storyline, and the CGI is the final nail in the coffin.

Review title: Best action movie seen so far
Review_body: I enjoyed this over the top extravagant adventure set in Ancient Egypt. The script cleverly uses the legends of the Egyptian gods. It's fun to see the god brought to life and transform into various birds and beasts. Now everyone can visualize the gods instead of imagining them from a 2 dimensional painting on a wall. The tale of Horus avenging the murder of his father Osiris by fighting Set is brought to life. The visuals are spectacular dizzying and fantastical. You get some pretty impressive cities temples caves tombs pyramids and the underworld. This movie was so far the best action this year. I don't know why people are hating. This movie was fun, entertaining, funny, loved the action scenes. Loved how the movie was viewed just like the stories we all loved in school. You won't be disappointed. Got to see this movie at a prescreening. Loved it. Would watch again.

Of note, I adore this type of silly romp and Gerard Butler is one of my absolute favorites. With that said, could they possible have done a worse job of casting the leads in this movie (It was as if he reprized One Two from, Rocknrolla, but wearing "godly" armor)? There are many excellent actors out there that would have been able to pull off the leads: take Oded Fehr for example; while not from Egypt, he's at least from the same continent and has the look, talent and comedic timing, sorely missing in this movie, to make an excellent Horus (Amr Waked would have made an wicked Set). Pretty much any decent actor would have filled the role of the young hero better than the insipid portrayal by Brenton Thawaites.Visually this was enjoyable and I wanted to like it. The $17.00 for the (3D) ticket was the only thing that kept me from walking out.

It's sad to see so many people disliking this movie...but throughout the movie i found the action,comedy and love story to be awesome! The gods had beautiful and epic costumes. I can see some scenes at time being unrealistic, yes, but this is mythology! If you want a down to earth movie, then this is not for you. As for the actual characters, I was surprised at how some gods were so weak. The actors matched the characters they portrayed aside from the fact that some looked so old when as a god, I don't think they needed to look that way. Battle music could have been an addition they could have done. The transformations were super cool. I would highly recommend this movie. It is one of my favourites and will probably be wanting to see it again in theatres.

I thought the movie was creative with an actual story and plot that was easy to follow. The graphics were good. And the best part, it was clean like the old Hollywood movies that required wit, true acting, and not just zeroing in on the eyes and expressions for fake dramatics. If you don't like mythology or science fiction, then no you probably won't like it, but if you like mythology, then it's good. It adds a twist to that old traditional take on mythology. Just need an open mind.It was weird seeing Gerard Butler as the antagonist, but he did a good job of playing the part. It was a nice change to see real acting for a change instead of the played up camera zooming.

HOW DO YOU HAVE AN ALL WHITE CAST FOR A MOVIE ABOUT EGYPTIANS WHICH EXIST IN Africa. Americans make me sick . horrible movie just shows the continuous racism in Hollywood and in life .I hope filmmakers get it together. cultural appropriation at its finest . if you want to see a move about the history of BLACKS portrayed by and all WHITE cast this is the movie for you. Can't believe there's even 5 star ratings for this film. lions gate needs to get it together and so do the reviewers . The fact this movie was even created makes me want to vomit . It's like casting a black man as the role of Hitler . Seriously sickened by this . only reason I haven't finished is because of the stupid IDBM guidelines

Review title: Loved the movie and would recommend it
Review_body: I always loved the symbols and imagery of Egyptian mythology. I read a lot about it growing up and even took a course to learn how to write in hieroglyphics. I knew that it would be great on the big screen and regardless what the "professional critics" said, I could not wait to see it. I agree that it won't win best picture of the year but if you are open to seeing an amazing cinematic imagery then you will love it. The base story has it's positive and negative but it made sense. Yes there was lots of CGI but it was perfect if you compare it to the 'Mummy' series of movies with Brendan Fraser. I can't wait to what it when it comes out on Blue-ray. Are there holes or Hmmm in the story yes but for me it was totally worth seeing it on the big screen. Hope that you can make your own decision and ignore critics....I always have and always will.

Review title: Can't get any better for a mythological movie.
Review_body: Finally something that could entertain me in 2016. I don't know what the critics are about. This movie was really good. A bit of a farce and some of the animation could have been better. However still an excellent movie. These actors appeared to be 100% invested in making this film work, and they got the job done, in my opinion. I'm extremely impressed to see this excellent movie based on ancient Egypt that is certainly for me this movie has done justice for the money invested.Critics are again all over the fact that predominantly white actors are playing Egyptians, oh come on! We pay to get entertain and trust me i was totally impressed.

Gods of Egypt wasn't the movie I set out to watch, last Saturday, but, boy, am I glad that my first choice was unavailable. Otherwise, I would have missed this striking, action-packed, energetic and flashy movie. I had a blast, and plan to see it again. There was something for everyone; great special effects, romance, action, danger and humor.While it did not adhere particularly closely to Egyptian mythology, that's probably for the best. Some of those myths can get pretty disturbing. What it did do was deliver lots of fun and eye-candy. I did not leave my seat, glance at my phone messages or remember my popcorn, once the movie began. When you stop chewing and forget where you are, you know you're having fun at the movies.The characters were enjoyable (especially Horus, who came across as grumpy and hung-over, at first, but eventually got himself sorted). Set was genuinely villainous, and Ra's flat Earth, Sun-towing scene a real treat. I found myself really liking Hathor, as well. The two kids, Bek and Zaya, were cute, reminding me just a little of Aladin and Jasmine. Yu genuinely cared about Zaya, on her journey through the frighteningly bleak Egyptian underworld. About Hathor, too, actually, but I won't spoil things and say why.Personally, I rate this movie on par with Avengers: Age of Ultron, and above the last Star Wars movie, which I saw just once. Go see Gods of Egypt. You'll be glad that you did.

This is way better than those boring cookie cutters comic series from Marvel. How did Antman earn 7.4 rating and pg13 ? That movie is so trashy full of obscene words it deserves an X. Let audience be warned.Story line is refreshing. Good originality. Good visual. Good sound. Reviewers compared this to Clash of the Titans. This is a far better movie.Maybe people just don't like Egypt. All the negativity associated with mid east turn people off. Thus the low rating. Can't believe all the negative syndicated reviews. Is it because this is from a small company. Not a power house like Marvell ?

I didn't realise this movie had so many Australians in it! The first 5 minutes I thought OMG this is not going to meet my expectations. I was wrong. I loved it. Totally enjoyable. Lots of action. Great lines. Laughed heaps. Thought Bek was great. Highly entertaining. I wanted to stop here, but I need to write 10 lines of review. The CGI was great. The action scenes were full on. Time passed quickly, so the editing was spot on. Go and see it, especially if you are Australian! Support our film industry. Surely I have written 10 lines now :0) No! Set the villain did fantastic job. Go and see it. Go and see it. Go and see it. :0)

Wow.. I won't go through technical evaluation but what really struck me with that movie is the Ironic resemblance to reality ... the dialogue between Raah and Horus when he was debating that Set was a bad ruler for Egypt and his answer that Apophis (god of chaos) is the worst fate that can strike Egypt and that he is worse than Set !! As an Egyptian I can say that this is so true even now .. chaos is the worst fate that already struck the middle east and we managed to escape it so far .. well I won't dwell on other aspects of resemblance ..The movie is worth seeing and is inspiring ..acting of Gerard Butler is as usual great although he offered nothing new in this role . Graphics are amazing and in general this movie is quite entertaining and greatly underrated . I am half way through the movie so far but had to write this comment before I forgot it as I usually enjoy movies with subtle substance. maybe would come back for more :)

Review title: Don't listen to reviews and critics they are miss-leading
Review_body: OK this is the first time I am leaving a review and I just couldn't stand these bad reviews that are like for nothing. The movie is ABSOLUTELY great and you will not lose interest not even for 2 minutes since it's a major action-adventure movie with great actors and cast choice, following very awesome and interesting story line that will make you wonder throughout the movie how will things turn out to be. It wasn't very predictable even tho it wasn't complex AT ALL. Some of these reviews make me wonder if people enjoy any movie without finding or creating the slightest reason to be dramatic and annoying, just like the reason most reviews I read here saying the actor choice is TOO white? Are you kidding me this is a Hollywood made, fiction movie about the Egypt and gods and powers and that's what bothered them really? Anyways the movie is awesome and like I said don't bother reading reviews. thanks

Review title: Thrilling and Exciting Movie that Still Got it ALL WRONG
Review_body: Oh God, yet ANOTHER movie about a WHITEWASHED version of Egypt. Based on ancient Egyptian mythology, Gods of Egypt features the epic journey of a mortal named Bek to save his true love from death and rescue Egypt. Along the way, he is assisted by the god of the air, Horus, who is fighting against Set, the god of darkness who has proclaimed himself the rightful ruler of Egypt. This film has everything an eager movie goer could want: an out-of-this world plot, special effects, an epic setting (who doesn't like Ancient Egypt??), romance, thrill, humor, and sweeping music. YET...it is about as accurate as watching an ALL BLACK version of 300 (Spartan movie) or Gladiator. Hollywood would be in an uproar. I'm sorry but as much as I liked the movie, I couldn't feel at ease sitting and watching a BOLD-FACED LIE. The whole time I felt like I was in some sort of DELUDED Caucasian/Asian FANTASY of an Egypt without African roots. There were just too many subtly insulting scenes in the movie to mention, but the overall feeling I got from the film was a sense of European ego-centrism. The only significant black character is Thoth, the god of wisdom; couldn't even make one goddess a Black woman even though they were often the rulers of ancient Egypt. No, the actress playing Hathor, the goddess of love, only serves to propagate racist, mainstream standards of beauty (non-black beauty), even if she's NOT blond haired and blue eyed. The idiot producers in Hollywood haven't figured it out yet (or they have and just don't want to ADMIT it)! The ORIGINAL ancient Egyptians were NUBIANS, Africans and people of color. It wasn't until the Hittites and other Caucasian peoples completely invaded Egypt that it became the diluted Egypt of today (Read The Destruction of Black Civilization by Chancellor Williams). That's why there are these delusions with some Arabs/Asians having the audacity and arrogance to somehow assume they ONLY are the true Egyptians (or denying Africans are). Look at movies like The Mummy, etc. Some may dismiss this as an Afrocentric rant and say that color doesn't matter and all that BS. But as a person of African descent, it's a little annoying to constantly have OUR history INACCURATELY portrayed by people who don't really wish to acknowledge us in the first place. STOP hijacking our history and projecting yourself into EVERY area of history you think you can do so!!! Hey Hollywood and SUMMIT ENTERTAINMENT, get a clue from DREAMWORKS and have some historical accuracy. Look The Prince of Egypt, Joseph King of Dreams, and even La Reine Soleil (produced by Cinemon Studios). They got it right, and those are ANIMATED movies. Oh but why wouldn't they want to use an all- black cast? Because most whites would never want to see it, as they LACK empathy for brown/black people, as proved in scientific studies. I wouldn't be surprised if half the people watching this movie wouldn't entertain the idea of a Black Egypt. No, not just one anomaly black pharaoh but a lineage of African rulers who spanned many dynasties. All- in-all, maybe the movie would be 10 stars if they got the BASICS right.

Review title: So far from the Stories of the Egyptian Gods
Review_body: I had such high hopes at the beginning even when I watched the trailer, and yet I quickly became disappointed. It strayed so far from the actual stories of the Egptian Gods that I couldn't enjoy the movie. You can't kill a God so the entire idea of half of the movie makes no sense. It felt like they were taking the titles of the Gods and just making a whole new story line out of it. The CGI was good, and some of the humor, but I just found myself getting mad at the story and feeling exasperated all the way to the end. There are many loopholes in my opinion. And merging the parts of Gods together? Really? The architecture wasn't Egyptian, the clothing wasn't Egyptian, Ra looks nothing like the paintings. The Mythology was just absolutely destroyed in my opinion.

Ya know, it's bad enough history whitewashes everything to death do we really need another movie to lie to us while being absolutely trash? Whoever liked this movie is easy and should have a remote with one button straight to nickelodeon. Great actors who decided to read and memorize this script.. i guess they needed the money really bad.My other issue with this movie is the same as with most movies like this, the accents.The CG for me wasn't as bad as some said for me it's the story and the way it's being told from beginning to end, and i get that it's an action adventure but get the history right at least. It plays more like Aladdin the animated version i mean writers try harder next time the public is a lot smarter than the stuff you guys are putting out. I'm done venting please Hollywood stop making garbage like this.

I am a fan of actor Nikolaj Coaster-Waldau, that is why I felt empathy for him being associated with such a bad film. The amount of CG used in the movie was staggering, even taking into consideration that the world was mostly make believe. No effort was taken to use any tangible locations. I do have to give a little credit to all the actors, considering they most likely spent day after day filming in front of a green screen. The amount of CG was one thing and the poor CG quality was another. Coaster-Waldau, although solid, could not carry the entire film. The rest of the actors were indistinguishable and generally poor. The plot was uncomplicated, predictable, and bland. The premise of the movie was sound, it just wasn't executed competently.

Review title: Way better then the negative reviews it got.
Review_body: When I saw all the negative review this movie got, I decided to give it a chance anyway. After watching it and expecting it to be horrible, I was surprised to find it was way better then all the people complaining about it claimed. The story did not follow the Egyptian mythology completely and you could see many changes in the movie. Despite all of that it still made for very good entertainment. This is a movie I can enjoy watching multiple times. I loved the CGI and the way the actors portrayed their characters. I hope they make other movies like this in the future because I will definitely watch. I have come to the conclusion that I should watch more movies that get negative reviews because it seems more often then not, most of these reviewers get it wrong and the movies turn out way better than they say.

Review title: Excellent visuals and great actors, that's it
Review_body: This movie kinda of sucked. I would have given it two stars, were it not for the visuals and the actors Butler and Waldau. Forget about the whole mostly-white-actors-in-a-movie-set-in-Egypt, forget about that. Something that irked me, almost more than what I am to talk about later, were the lame, "witty" jokes- the comments down the road, the whole trying to take a break from action by pausing a few seconds just to say something "funny", even though it was in the midst of the heat of all of it. And the thing is, it was darn corny and stupid! I couldn't even laugh, it was just really distracting!Now for the main part, I HATED how they progressed so easily, so quickly- NO effort. The problem solving was so straight forward, no struggle at all. This took away the excitement, the thrill- no blood pumping here, just my neck aching from having to drag myself through this movie. The lines the poor actors had to say in this movie, I mean- who wrote this? Seriously? I cringed whenever something dramatic was happening, I would rather hear them do the boring "journey talk" they did during some points in the movie. Actually, I cringed over how casually they said anything in the movie, except for epic Gerard Butler, as he was mostly like he was in all his badass movies.And bad fights, like wow, bad. Only visuals saved them from me just shutting off.Enough ranting now, for short:Good:Great visualsGreat actors (Fan of Gerard Butler, hehe)BAD:Witty, not-so-witty comments throughoutCringy manuscript, couldn't even move the most sensitive person in the whole world. (Bad acting, seemed like the actors struggled to make it flow because of how the lines were set up)Boring problem solving all the way, it was made too easily, too sudden and with no struggle at all (plus the annoying "jokes" [?] in the midst of it.)Bad fights, and they were the best part because of the visuals.By the way, I kind of don't like how people give more stars to off- set the bad reviews from other reviewers, JUST because they want to defend it from critique with mostly white actors for characters from Egypt. People can say it had a bad impact on their experience of the movie, since after all- the setting was Egypt and Egyptian gods, hence they can rate it from that point on. But to give it MORE stars to off-set the bad reviews on the non-logical casting of the movie is plain moronic, you ruin the whole rating system because you do not review based on the movie, but on what others have rated it as- and no, I do not care about the white actors at all. Actors are actors, as long as they do great, I don't care!

Review title: Gods of Egypt is so laughably bad that it's for sure entertaining
Review_body: Gods of Egypt is definitely an entertaining movie, but in all the wrong ways. Almost everything about it is hysterically awful. You will laugh your ass off throughout the movie, not because of the "jokes" in the film, but because of the dialogue, the CGI, the acting, etc.The setting for the movie was to be it's strongest asset. When was the last time we got to see a movie set in Egyptian mythology? However, the movie does not do it's setting justice and people who like the mythology would be ashamed by how the movie interprets it.The dialogue for the movie is horrendous. Every single line is either an exposition line or a horribly unnatural and forced line. The characters are are all so one-dimensional, each seemingly having only one personality trait, and only a very small amount of characters undergo the tiniest bit of development. Because of this, we're given no reason to care about anyone. A good portion of the lines are so hilarious, not because they were funny, but because they're entertaining in the sense that people actually came up with this dialogue and others approved of it.Being a huge, high-budget, blockbuster action movie, you would think that it would be at least cool to look at. To be honest, the CGI and special effects are a mixed bag. Most of the time, everything looks awful. There is not a single shot in the movie which looks real and everything is so obviously green-screen. However, there are still a few CGI moments that don't look terrible. However, it doesn't make a movie good, it just means that there are some decent-looking effects in an otherwise garbage movie.I can't believe the talent behind the movie created such a piece of garbage. I would give it a 1, but the movie is so entertaining because of how bad it is, it gets a 3 purely because it's entertaining. Watch the movie if you're drunk at a party with friends but don't watch the movie because you want to watch an awesome, action-packed movie.

This is a movie of ancient gods, their flaws, greed and motives. A story for the ages where Egyptian gods, flawed by their humane desires, walk side by side with native mortals. A true Cinderella story where all is normal, then turned into chaos, climaxing with dreadful end of the world type happenings summoning unlikely heroes and ending in a rather ceremonious great resurrection of life and peace. Even with all of the supernatural beings and gods ruling over humans, or mortals as this film says, the story remained within the humane lines of moral dilemmas and relations between admiration and resent, love and hate, greed and generosity and trusting or doubting others. Really, this motion picture is a visually beautiful, often quite remarkable, piece of cinema, sadly, eternally ruined by poorly edited and rushed content. This potential diamond was honestly neglected enough so that it was reprocessed into mere coal. This was noticeable from pretty much the first scenes already. The actors dialogues felt very forced up to the point where I could imagine the director, Alex Proyas, shouting for actors to be quicker and less savoring with their lines. The scenes were too hastily run through and as this progressed throughout the film, the quality of a golden story was turned into a, at most, B-class film. I expected more and thought it could've been a bit slower with the progression of things, instead of rushing into events and lines like some kind of a speed trial. If I could I would choose not to watch it, just to save the thought of a great, action filled, story with gods and mortals. I'm sorry for the actors and the teams behind this movie. For they most certainly did not deserve this kind of a result.

Review title: Fantastic movie - completely unique - watch it!
Review_body: Loved this film from start to finish - I found it entirely immersing and just great fun. Never seen anything like this so massive congrats to the makers for pushing the boundaries. The humour was funny and worked well throughout. The casting is spot on - every actor played their part fantastically well. Character development is awesome - I ended up really liking all lead characters. Good job. The special effects are top notch and the pacing is fast - never a dull moment with this movie. If you like the fantasy genre you'll love this - everything you could ask for - believable monsters, exciting fight scenes, epic scale, beautiful backdrops (Egypt is amazing), a bit of magic and some extra stuff that you'll have to watch to find out but works really well and really adds another dimension to the film. I really hope that they make a sequel. The romance is believable and moving - and I'm not usually a big fan of romance in fantasy films. This production really carries you away to another world to enjoy - and that's what I look for in a good flick. There's so many twists, turns, unexpected stunts and unusual story elements - it really is a great story. I don't understand why this is only a 5.5 score because I think it's the best film I've seen all year! Can't praise this film enough - just watch it!

Review title: Gibberish, so bad it can't even entertain
Review_body: Don't get me wrong, I love a CGI fuelled action / adventure film where you can switch off your brain but this was dreadful. Random scenes barely hung together and made no sense. Some great actors but shockingly bad. Avoid.

It hurt my eyes to watch such abomination against every Good movie ever made. It should be prohibited to make low quality movies as this One. Its a crime it is still avaiable to public. Bad performance, bad graphics, terible history. Everything is Random and non-sense. Don't waste your precious life watching it.

Nearly didn't watch this because of the (unwarranted) ratings. Forget the factual and glaring faux pa's, and settle down for a couple of hours of brilliant storytelling that is surprisingly enjoyable. For any fans of myths and legends, swords and sorcery and anything else in a similar genre, pull up a chair, relax and enjoy the fun. Well worth the time to watch

This would have been better if the Gods of Egypt even looked like the Gods of Egypt and not some racist Hollywood wet dream. I was not looking for a history lesson in this movie but DANG!!! The only god of color was a self centered babbling idiot?! Seriously!? For all you that do not understand what the big deal is, the equivalent would be watching a Thor movie Oden played by James Earl Jones, Fyorgyn - Alfre Woodard, Thor- Michael B Jordan, and the only Caucasian god (a sub level one at that) in the movie was Mr. Bean. Continuing on in comparison, everyone serving the royals of color would be white. And then have all the people of Asgard be Spanish, Asian, Greek, Black, and a few other Caucasian people here and there. It was insulting and it was very, very hard to get past.The cgi was well done but the content of the movie was not great. It was like someone on shrooms said "Let do this, lets do that.." and the guy smoking weed said "Yea man, lets add giant snakes too" And a sober female said don't forget to add a love story to it so its not a total sausage fest...

A giant snoozefest, no intruiging story, sloppy production and paycheck acting. Not much more to say about this, just plain bad and perfectly hateable. Though a good reminder of simply how bad big productions can get.

Review title: It's a fantasy movie, not historical fiction
Review_body: Don't take the movie seriously when you watch it, it's fantasy and should be taken as such. Anybody complaining about "whitewashing" has misinterpreted what sort of movie this is. Admittedly, the first time that I tried watching this, I shut it off within the first ten minutes. I decided to take a chance on it this evening, and thoroughly enjoyed myself.

Review title: An adventure that's lots of fun!
Review_body: Colorful characters and a loveable main character make this movie of fun one to watch. It may not have a top-notch plot but the plot is good enough the acting is good and the visually effects are delightful. Embedded in the plot is a love story that you can relate to with a lot of fun adventure and action. Gerard Butler is a convincing antagonist , and I really enjoyed this movie all in all. Give it a watch!

I so much wanted to like this. I was brought up on Jason & the Argonauts, Clash of the Titans and the Sinbads. This was Egyptian mythology, Gerard Butler & Jamie Lannister, I thought, what can go wrong? Well just about everything, the acting and CGI are terrible, the only saving grace is Jamie Lannister. Such a shame, could have been a classic!

Review title: When the technology is more important than the story
Review_body: There is so much inspiration we can get from ancient Egypt, or Greek mythology. Taken it is a fantasy movie, the story is rather poor and the actors not performing at their best. Costumes are good (surely better than THOR!), but the characters clearly not having an Egyptian look. Lots of money for not much. The 10 Commandments is still the best in the topic, and was produced half a century ago!
